Package processing.sound

Class FFT

  • java.lang.Object
    • processing.sound.FFT

  • public class FFT
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) analyzer. It calculates the normalized power spectrum of an audio stream the moment it is queried with the analyze() method.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      float[] spectrum

      Calculates the current frequency spectrum from the input source, writes it into this FFT's `spectrum` array, and returns it.

    • Field Detail

      • spectrum

        public float[] spectrum

    • Constructor Detail

      • FFT

        public FFT​(processing.core.PApplet parent)

      • FFT

        public FFT​(processing.core.PApplet parent,
           int bands)
        Parameters:
        parent - typically use "this"
        bands - number of frequency bands for the FFT as an integer (default 512). This parameter needs to be a power of 2 (e.g. 16, 32, 64, 128, ...).

    • Method Detail

      • analyze

        public float[] analyze​()
        Calculates the current frequency spectrum from the input source, writes it into this FFT's `spectrum` array, and returns it.
        Returns:
        the current frequency spectrum of the input source. The array has as many elements as this FFT analyzer's number of frequency bands

      • analyze

        public float[] analyze​(float[] value)
        Calculates the current frequency spectrum from the input source.
        Parameters:
        value - an array with as many elements as this FFT analyzer's number of frequency bands
        Returns:
        The current frequency spectrum of the input source. The array has as many elements as this FFT analyzer's number of frequency bands.

      • input

        public void input​(SoundObject input)
        Define the audio input for the analyzer.
        Parameters:
        input - the input sound source. Can be an oscillator, noise generator, SoundFile or AudioIn.
